summary: This document is an email chain from March 6, 2019, between an FBI agent and a U.S. Attorney's Office contractor, with an AUSA copied, coordinating the logistics for the FBI to transfer a large amount of data related to the Epstein case to the USAO for uploading to a shared system.

persons.name: I. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: The FBI case agent coordinating the transfer of Epstein case data to the U.S. Attorney's Office. They are arranging a meeting time and location.

persons.name: (USANYS) [Contractor]
persons.context: A contractor for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, receiving the Epstein case data from the FBI for upload to a shared system. They provide their room location (870).

connections.description: Coordinating the logistics for the physical transfer of a large amount of Epstein case data from the FBI to the USAO contractor for digital upload.
The AUSA (M) requests that the FBI case agent provide data to the USAO contractor, indicating a working relationship on the Epstein case.
The AUSA (M) is directing the contractor to receive and upload the Epstein case data, indicating a supervisory or tasking relationship.

events.title: Coordination for Epstein Data Transfer
events.description: Email coordination between an FBI agent and a USAO contractor to arrange a meeting for the FBI to hand over a large amount of Epstein case data for uploading to a shared system.

locations.name: One Saint Andrew's Plaza
locations.context: The address of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in New York, NY, from which the AUSA (M) is corresponding.

locations.name: Room 870, 8th floor
locations.context: The office location of the USAO contractor where the Epstein data transfer meeting is to take place.

keyFacts: The FBI possessed a 'large amount of data' on the Epstein case as of March 2019, which was being actively transferred to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The transfer required physical coordination between an FBI case agent and a USAO contractor for uploading to a shared digital system.
The correspondence shows ongoing investigative activity and evidence handling in the Epstein case in early 2019, prior to Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
